subject: Re: [junit] displaying multiple errors from the same condition
msgSnippet: ... Yes, it s the standard design pattern for this. But why wouldn t I be able to pass parameters to my test methods, just like I do all the time in regular
messageBody:
On 11/29/05, James Abley <james.abley@...> wrote:
>
> On 28/11/05, David Jackman <david.jackman@...> wrote:
> > In this case, I would have my test ping each URL, then in case of
> > failure add the URL to a list of failed URLs (no assertions here). At
> > the end of the loop, assert that the list of failed URLs is empty and
> > have the failure message include the list of URLs.
>
> Or google for parameterized test case, which has been discussed on
> this list fairly recently with good examples.


Yes, it's the standard design pattern for this.

But why wouldn't I be able to pass parameters to my test methods, just like
I do all the time in "regular" Java?

--
Cédric


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
